title: `pl.from_repr` doesnt respect sign of `duration` type
body:
### Checks

- [x] I have checked that this issue has not already been reported.
- [x] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [latest version](https://pypi.org/project/polars/) of Polars.

### Reproducible example

```python
pl.from_repr(
        """
        shape: (7, 2)
        ┌──────────────┬──────────────┐
        │ time_offset  ┆ normal_curve │
        │ ---          ┆ ---          │
        │ duration[μs] ┆ f64          │
        ╞══════════════╪══════════════╡
        │ -3h          ┆ 0.011109     │
        │ -2h          ┆ 0.135335     │
        │ -1h          ┆ 0.606531     │
        │ 0µs          ┆ 1.0          │
        │ 1h           ┆ 0.606531     │
        │ 2h           ┆ 0.135335     │
        │ 3h           ┆ 0.011109     │
        └──────────────┴──────────────┘
        """
    )
```

### Log output

```shell
shape: (7, 2)
        ┌──────────────┬──────────────┐
        │ time_offset  ┆ normal_curve │
        │ ---          ┆ ---          │
        │ duration[μs] ┆ f64          │
        ╞══════════════╪══════════════╡
        │ 3h          ┆ 0.011109     │
        │ 2h          ┆ 0.135335     │
        │ 1h          ┆ 0.606531     │
        │ 0µs          ┆ 1.0          │
        │ 1h           ┆ 0.606531     │
        │ 2h           ┆ 0.135335     │
        │ 3h           ┆ 0.011109     │
        └──────────────┴──────────────┘
```

### Issue description

does no respect sign of duration

### Expected behavior

should respect sign for the `duration` type

### Installed versions

<details>

```--------Version info---------
Polars:              1.32.3
Index type:          UInt32
Platform:            Linux-6.6.87.2-microsoft-standard-WSL2-x86_64-with-glibc2.36
Python:              3.12.11 | packaged by conda-forge | (main, Jun  4 2025, 14:45:31) [GCC 13.3.0]
LTS CPU:             False

----Optional dependencies----
Azure CLI            <not installed>
adbc_driver_manager  <not installed>
altair               <not installed>
azure.identity       <not installed>

cloudpickle          3.1.1
connectorx           <not installed>

```

</details>
